title: After 20 Protesters' Arrest, I&B Minister Prakash Javadekar Is Seeking Report On Bigg Boss 13
text:
First it was Confederation Of All India Traders (CAIT), then it was a BJP MLA Nand Kishore Gurjar, and then the Rajput Karni Sena – a lot of people and groups have been seeking ban on Bigg Boss. Why? Because they apparently have a problem with the BFF (Bed Friends Forever) concept on the show.

Since Bigg Boss 13 has aired, it has been mired in controversies and there seems to be no end for them anytime soon. After Rajput Karni Sena appealed for a ban and complained against the show, Mumbai Police had tightened the security outside Salman Khan’s house. And just as we imagined, people have been protesting outside his home.

Now, as per report on Bollywood Hungama, 20 people were arrested on Friday for they were protesting outside Salman Khan's house. Also, a video which is doing the rounds on social media, a man can be seen standing outside Salman Khan’s house and protesting while warning the actor as well as the makers to stop spreading obscenity in Bigg Boss House.

Meanwhile, I&B Minister Prakash Javadekar who has received complaints from CAIT, Karni Sena and the BJP MLA, said that he has sought report on the show.

"I have asked Ministry officials for a report on what is being shown (on the Big Boss show). We will be getting the report this week,” he was quoted as saying by DNA.

It all started after Bigg Boss introduced BFF concept on the show, according to which contestants were given partners to share bed with. A Hindu-Muslim angle was given to scenario, after Hindu girl Mahira Sharma was seen sharing bed with Kashmiri Muslim Asim Riaz. Some even claimed that the show is promoting Love Jihad. However, after the first week, the makers revoked the rule and since then contestants have been choosing their bed partners on their own. But the issues and complaints against the show haven’t stopped yet.
